channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: ‘All of the SEC’s claims fail’ — Binance.US rebuts motion to freeze funds
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Binance.US has lodged its defense ahead of the June 13 hearing on whether its funds will be frozen.

item.title: SEC’s Gensler says BTC, ETH ‘not securities’ in a newly surfaced video
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The 2018-era Gensler appeared much more lenient towards certain cryptocurrencies, including Ether.

item.title: Jump Trading seeks to move Terra class action suit to California
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The lawsuit, initially filed on May 9, alleges the firm and its CEO was involved in a price manipulation scheme tied to the TerraUSD stablecoin.

item.title: Atomic Wallet hackers turn to OFAC-sanctioned Garantex: Elliptic
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Stolen loot crypto from Atomic wallets has started passing through sanctioned Russian-based exchange Garantex, according to Elliptic.

item.title: UN report highlights ‘serious and urgent’ concerns about AI deepfakes
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The UN wants to address AI-generated fake news and information as the organization looks to bring in voluntary guidelines for the technology.

item.title: Fear of blockchain will have 'disastrous consequences' — Ava Labs CEO testimony
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Gün Sirer says the U.S. “won the first wave of the internet revolution” because it enabled responsible innovation. Now, it must do the same with blockchain.

item.title: Ripple CEO: Hinman docs are ‘well worth the wait’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Brad Garlinghouse hinted that the eagerly awaited Hinman documents, which detail internal deliberations by Securities and Exchange Commission staff, could tip the court battle in Ripple’s favor.

item.title: eToro halts ALGO, MANA, MATIC and DASH purchases for US customers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The firm said it remains a “supporter” of the crypto sector and suggested that the move was purely to avoid any potential regulatory non-compliance.

item.title: Binance.US hires former SEC enforcement official amid lawsuit: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Former SEC enforcement co-director George Canellos reportedly joins the Binance.US legal team as the firm faces challenges to keep its assets unfrozen.

item.title: Polygon 2.0 introduces upgrades to tap into ‘Value Layer’ of internet
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: According to Polygon Labs, Polygon 2.0 will enable users to create, exchange and program value on the internet.

item.title: Ripple expands Canadian engineering activities with U of Toronto XRP validator
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Canada’s largest university is the third in the country to partner with Ripple’s University Blockchain Research Initiative.

item.title: Bitcoin on-chain data shows miners offloading BTC as revenues shrink
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Nivesh Rustgi
item.description: Bitcoin miners have been selling BTC since the start of June, potentially adding further pressure to the BTC price.

item.title: Lawmakers introduce bill to remove SEC chair — but do they have the authority?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: A Supreme Court decision ruled that the U.S. president could not remove commissioners except for “standard of inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance.”

item.title: Thailand launches retail CBDC pilot with 2 banks and Singapore payment service
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The project, delayed from last year, will enlist bank employees and nearby businesses for the pilot. Each payment provider has launched its own app.

item.title: Why is the crypto market down today?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.description: The crypto market is down today as macro headwinds scare off investors and reduce liquidity.

item.title: Bank of China issues $28M in digital structured notes on Ethereum blockchain
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The securitized tokens are governed by Hong Kong and Swiss law.

item.title: ​​Crypto fund outflows reach $417M over 8 weeks as investor caution persists
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: According to CoinShares, digital asset investment product outflows amounted to $88 million last week.

item.title: Price analysis 6/12: SPX, DXY, BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, ADA, DOGE, SOL, MATIC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Market observers will closely watch the United States CPI data and the Fed’s policy decision to provide direction to the stock and crypto markets.

item.title: The first-world debt crisis means you can expect more pain ahead
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Igor Varnavsky
item.description: You should be prepared for gradual deterioration in your quality of life — or search for alternative assets that could protect your wealth.

item.title: Breaking: US lawmakers file ‘SEC Stabilization Act’ to fire Gary Gensler
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: “U.S. capital markets must be protected from a tyrannical Chairman, including the current one," Rep. Warren Davidson wrote in reference to SEC head Gary Gensler.

item.title: UK to get ‘early or priority access’ to AI models from Google and OpenAI
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: It’s unclear at this time what access the U.K. will receive, but the reported commitment could be the first of its kind.

item.title: Bitcoin and select altcoins show resilience even as the crypto market sell-off continues
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Regulatory enforcement against the crypto sector has spooked investors, but the total crypto market capitalization continues to hold above $1 trillion.

item.title: US court dismisses BitGo’s claims in $100M lawsuit against Galaxy Digital
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Vice Chancellor J. Travis Laster of the Delaware Court of Chancery said Galaxy had a “clean termination right” to the acquisition of BitGo, which it announced in 2022.

item.title: Is Ron DeSantis good for crypto? Republican makes Bitcoin part of campaign
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The governor of Florida wants to defend people’s right to “do Bitcoin.”

item.title: AI Eye: Is AI a nuke-level threat? Why AI fields all advance at once, dumb pic puns
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Andrew Fenton
item.description: Is AI an existential threat like nuclear weapons, or as likely to kill us as a toaster? Why all AI fields advance at once, and dumb pic puns.

item.title: Tether CTO clarifies $1B USDT mint on Ethereum is for chain swaps
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The move is Tether’s second $1 billion mint in two months, bringing the total USDT minted by the stablecoin issuer in 2023 to over $16 billion.

item.title: Bitcoin to fight against European challenges — Northern Lightning founder
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: The Bitcoin community continues to develop tools and services that could be helpful as Europe grapples with conflict, migration and government overreach.

item.title: BTC Prague 2023: ‘Anyone can produce value in the Bitcoin ecosystem’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: Wolf von Laer, the CEO of Students for Liberty, spoke with Cointelegraph about the nature of the Bitcoin community and the need for more openness.

item.title: SEC, CPI and a ‘strong rebound’ — 5 things to know in Bitcoin this week
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin faces a week full of potential price triggers — both up and down — as BTC price action drops below a major trend line.

item.title: Cardano’s worst week since May 2021 is over — Will ADA price rebound 40%?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.category: why is cardano price down today
where will ADA price go next
item.description: The price of Cardano lost 30% over the past week as it was delisted from popular trading platforms like Robinhood.
